meanings.sent1: The enface portrait captured the subject looking directly at the camera.
meanings.sent2: The enface view of the building showed its front facade clearly.
meanings.sent3: The enface teddy bear on the shelf seemed to be watching over the room.
meanings.sent4: Her enface smile lit up the room like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The enface position of the soldier made him stand out among the crowd.

meanings.definition: To present a surface or side to the front
meanings.sent1: She decided to enface the painting on the wall for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to enface the sculpture towards the entrance of the gallery.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally enfaced the wrong side of the bookshelf, making it hard to access.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully enfaced the dish on the plate, creating a stunning presentation.
meanings.sent5: The architect planned to enface the windows towards the garden for a beautiful view.

meanings.sent1: The owl perched enface on the branch, scanning the surroundings for prey.
meanings.sent2: She stood enface to the audience, ready to deliver her speech.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat enface to the window, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The car parked enface to the curb, making it easier to pull out.
meanings.sent5: The signpost pointed enface towards the hiking trail, guiding the hikers.
